circumstances:
En route, one of the wing failed. The twin engine aircraft went out of control, dove into the ground and crashed in a field, killing both crew members. 
Crew (1st SFTS):
P/O Walter Webb,
LAC Ian McIntyre.
probable_cause: According to the RNZAF, the accident was caused by the structural failure of a wing in flight. This was caused by faulty maneuvers (aerobatic) on part of the crew who positioned the aircraft in a wrong attitude, causing the forces to exceed the design of the wing that failed.
